This vignette shows how one Zashboard spec builds four targets: static HTML, a Shiny app, a Shinylive app, and a Quarto site - using only the built-in datasets::mtcars.

```{r}
library(zashboard)
spec <- system.file("examples/mtcars/mtcars.yml", package = "zashboard", mustWork = TRUE)
```

## Static HTML

```{r}
static_dir <- zashboard::build_static(spec, overwrite = TRUE)
static_dir
```

## Shinylive

```{r}
sl_dir <- zashboard::build_shinylive(spec, overwrite = TRUE)
sl_dir
```

## Shiny app

Run this part interactively.

```{r eval=FALSE}
# app <- zashboard::build_shiny(spec)
# shiny::runApp(app)
```

## Quarto project

```{r}
qdir <- file.path(tempdir(), "zash-mtcars-quarto")
zashboard::build_quarto(spec, out_dir = qdir, overwrite = TRUE)
qdir
```

That is it - one spec, four targets.
